channel.title: Hacker News - English
channel.description: Hacker News articles summarized and translated to English

item.title: You Don't Need Anubis
item.description:
But it seems like most users of Anubis don’t need DDoS protection - only protection agaist agressive LLM scrapers. And if that’s your only usecase, you probably don’t need Anubis. People often claim that Anubis stops bots by making it too computationally expensive to access your website.

Read more

item.title: LM8560, the eternal chip from the 1980 years
item.description:
The modern alarm clocks with LED display are made with micro controller chips. – What digital alarm clocks before it were like Until the late 1970s and early 1980s, digital alarm clocks were somewhat more challenging cost devices than today. The size of the alarm clocks was also considerably larger.

Read more

item.title: From 400 Mbps to 1.7 Gbps: A WiFi 7 Debugging Journey
item.description:
This typically gives better results on WiFi since the AP has stronger transmit power than phones, and the phone only needs to send tiny ACKs back. Meanwhile, reviewers were getting 1,635 Mbps average on 6 GHz with the UDR7, with peaks up to 1,890 Mbps. But looking at my iperf3 results when testing WiFi against 10.

item.title: The purported benefits of effect systems
item.description:
On the purported benefits of effect systems Intended audience: Programming language designers and enthusiasts with some passing familiarity with effect systems. Emmett: Let’s not change the topic, we’re talking about effect systems. Turns out, effects have many benefits.

Read more
